statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Sacramento State 107, Bethany (CA) 73
article.story: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) -- Sophomore guard Loren Leath had 23 points, including six 3-pointers, to lead Sacramento State over Bethany University 107-73 on Friday night in the opener for both teams. Alex Bausley had 18 points, eight assists and nine rebounds. Angel Alamo added 17 points, eight boards, and four steals for the Hornets, who have won their last eight home openers. Jon Bell had 22 points and 12 rebounds and Earnest Williams added 12 points and had five assists for the Bruins, a NAIA program from Scotts Valley. Sac State built a 21-point lead after Jason Davis hit a free throw at the 3:09 mark in the first half to make the score 53-32. Leath and Alamo combined for 30 points to give the Hornets a 60-42 halftime margin. Both teams shot over 60 percent from the field in the first half. The Bruins cut the lead 68-57 after Bell hit a reverse layup to make the score 68-57 with 14:50 left in second half. Bethany's Gabe Jenkins made a 3-pointer to put the score at 74-62. The Hornets answered with a 33-11 run to close out the game.
